--add-dir-header=false.Description: If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages

--alsologtostderr=false.Description: log to standard error as well as files

--as=''.Description: Username to impersonate for the operation. User could be a regular user or a service account in a namespace.

--as-group=[].Description: Group to impersonate for the operation, this flag can be repeated to specify multiple groups.

--as-uid=''.Description: UID to impersonate for the operation.

--certificate-authority=''.Description: Path to a cert file for the certificate authority

--client-certificate=''.Description: Path to a client certificate file for TLS

--client-key=''.Description: Path to a client key file for TLS

--cluster=''.Description: The name of the kubeconfig cluster to use

--context=''.Description: The name of the kubeconfig context to use

--insecure-skip-tls-verify=false.Description: If true, the server"s certificate will not be checked for validity. This will make your HTTPS connections insecure

--kubeconfig=''.Description: Path to the kubeconfig file to use for CLI requests.

--log-backtrace-at=:0.Description: when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace

--log-dir=''.Description: If non-empty, write log files in this directory

--log-file=''.Description: If non-empty, use this log file

--log-file-max-size=1800.Description: Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to. Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited.

--log-flush-frequency=5s.Description: Maximum number of seconds between log flushes

--loglevel=0.Description: Set the level of log output (0-10)

--logtostderr=true.Description: log to standard error instead of files

--match-server-version=false.Description: Require server version to match client version

--namespace=''.Description: If present, the namespace scope for this CLI request

--one-output=false.Description: If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level)

--request-timeout='0'.Description: The length of time to wait before giving up on a single server request. Non-zero values should contain a corresponding time unit (e.g. 1s, 2m, 3h). A value of zero means don"t timeout requests.

--server=''.Description: The address and port of the Kubernetes API server

--skip-headers=false.Description: If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages

--skip-log-headers=false.Description: If true, avoid headers when opening log files

--stderrthreshold=2.Description: logs at or above this threshold go to stderr

--tls-server-name=''.Description: Server name to use for server certificate validation. If it is not provided, the hostname used to contact the server is used.

--token=''.Description: Bearer token for authentication to the API server

--user=''.Description: The name of the kubeconfig user to use

--v=0.Description: number for the log level verbosity

--vmodule=.Description: comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging

--warnings-as-errors=false.Description: Treat warnings received from the server as errors and exit with a non-zero exit code
